doodle noun [C]
(SIMPLE DRAWING)
a picture or pattern that someone has drawn while thinking about something else or when they are bored: The textbooks had been defaced by doodles.
jayk7/Moment/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesHis studio floor is stacked with hundreds of notebooks and sketchbooks filled with thousands of doodles.The handwritten exclamation is accompanied by a doodle of a sinking ship.In a cab a few days later, I did a little doodle. To the untrained eye, the markings looked like nothing more than scribbles and doodles.

doodle noun [C]
(DOG)
(also oodle) a dog with one parent that is a poodle (= a breed of dog with curly hair) and one parent that is another breed: The orginal doodle was a Labradoodle. We want to get a doodle because they're hypoallergenic.
